private_information: I am free the entire day on Monday
Alice.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants

Daniel.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants

Scott.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants

orchestrator.goal: Orchestrate the participants to produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that schedules a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants

public_information: A 30 minute meeting must be scheduled on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
All participants listed must attend the same meeting
There exists at least one solution that fits everyone's schedule

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language) targeting the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that can be used by FastDownward. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is Alice. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->Alice->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->Alice->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to find a 30 minute slot on Monday within work hours that is compatible with your schedule and the public information. If you miss some information do not make assumptions just provide a plan concerning the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that can be used by FastDownward. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents you must keep their actions distinct and integrate their partial PDDL specifications into a single solvable PDDL for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: There are seven participants planning to schedule a meeting. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants. Keep in mind the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem but may require integrating additional information from other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms for example two PDDL problems may refer to the same time slot with different names. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Alice} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Daniel} Here is the information the third agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Scott} Here is the information the fourth agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Lori} Here is the information the fifth agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Cynthia} Here is the information the sixth agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Jeffrey} Here is the information the seventh agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_Hannah} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of all agents to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the agents distinct. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that FastDownward can solve to produce a meeting start time that satisfies all participants. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
